attributes.action: Academic research funded by the taxpayer should be free to read
attributes.background: The Government funds the majority of the UK’s academic research with taxpayer money. The results of this research, academic papers, are not accessible to the public because publishers charge £40 to read an article that is given to them for free. The public should not have to pay twice for research.
attributes.additional_details: You wouldn't be charged to enter an NHS hospital, why should you be charged to enter science? The British public is paying for 66% of university research (see: http://goo.gl/dnhLfw), but only 37% of it is free to read (http://goo.gl/4asiU8). Researchers give profitable publishers like Elsevier their work for free and can be charged as much as $5000 to hand over their own work (http://goo.gl/7in7LR). The policy fix: "Publicly funded research must be publicly available". More: http://goo.gl/sk1Hfa

attributes.action: Ban the use of sequential lighting indicators on cars; they are dangerously slow
attributes.background: Sequential lighting indicators use LEDs which expand over time to show the change of direction, these take a long time and can be distracting for other drivers.

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to have a free NHS flu jab from September 2018 onwards
attributes.background: Many people considered 'at risk' are fortunate enough to be vaccinated for free, however not everybody is. The recent outbreak has caused lots of people to suffer and even more strain on the NHS. It is counterproductive to deny the flu jab to 'healthy' people as we are not invincible and do get flu.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to pay to have the jab at a pharmacy, but they are not all equal. Some are better than others.

'For otherwise healthy people, flu can be very unpleasant.' - NHS Choices. They acknowledge this is the case for those deemed not to be at risk, yet still do not offer us protection. 

'The surge sparked fresh pleas from doctors for the millions of people who have not had the winter flu jab, including those at particular risk from the virus, to get immunised urgently.' - The Guardian

attributes.action: Implement Nutrition Education In the School System
attributes.background: Nutrition is part of everyone's mind everyday and most having no knowledge of what a nutritionally balanced, delicious meal consists of is absurd. Type 2 Diabetes, Coronary Heart Disease, and Obesity are on the rise. People depend on pills for the rest of their lives when a healthy diet is the cure.
attributes.additional_details: A plant-based diet according to research has been shown to reverse the diseases above. NHS money, time, and resources are being wasted as people believe drugs and pills are the way to health.  People resort to taking weight loss pills, statins (cholesterol-lowering drugs), and blood pressure-reducing pills yet have a heavily processed meal several times a day as they have no way out due to education. The NHS spends £14 billion pounds for type 2 diabetes alone! Think of where that money could go!

attributes.action: Abolish all customs tariffs against developing countries after Brexit.
attributes.background: Please ensure that developing countries do not face the cold shoulder of protectionism so that they are able to trade fairly and freely with us, please do this by unilaterally abolishing customs tariffs against them.

attributes.action: Ban social media that doesnt confirm your age officially or allows you anonymity
attributes.background: Social media is far too often used as a barrier to hide behind and bully others. Snapchat, Facebook, Sarahah, need to start confirming children's ages with official documents and stop allowing users to remain anonymous. Bullying can kill and it must be stopped.

attributes.action: Lower the drinking age to 16.
attributes.background: 16 is the legal age of consent and if you are thought resonsible enough to have a sexual relationship why aren't you thought responsible enough to drink safely?
attributes.additional_details: At the age of 16 you have finished high school and are staring sixthform or starting an apprenticeship. At this age you are responsible enough to handle money and know right from wrong.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public toilets to have better personal hygiene facilities
attributes.background: Everyday hundred of thousands of Britons use public bathrooms and there is only ever tissue! How can anyone clean them selves properly with just tissue. This also means that hundereds of thousand of Britons are walking around with with feces (harmful bacteria) on their bodies. It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details: more suitable cleaning apparatus EG: a Bidet shower

attributes.action: Introduce play as a statutory requirement across the primary national curriculum
attributes.background: Purposeful play is a central component of early years provision but the requirement for children to play should not end at Year 1. Play should be a requirement within the national curriculum ensuring all children are provided with opportunities for purposeful play across the primary age range.
attributes.additional_details: Play is a protected right for children under Article 31 of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. When planned and led effectively different types of purposeful play contribute to the spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of the child. Although some schools provide children with this opportunity beyond early years as part of their core provision this should be a requirement for all UK schools.

attributes.action: Changing a man's name after marriage.
attributes.background: Currently in the UK men are unable to use a marriage certificate as proof to change their name when taking their wife's last name. However woman are allowed to use a marriage certificate as proof to take the mans name. A man has to change his name by deed poll, a woman does not.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe in equality and for that reason a marriage certificate should be proof enough to change your name even if you are a man taking your wife's name, or a man taking your husband's name. 

Lets break the tradition and make a change.

attributes.action: ILR easier to get for spouse of British citizen married 5 years+ wt British kids
attributes.background: British citizens who marry non citizens have the right to live with their spouses in the UK especially when it is obvious that their marriage is sincere with British children together. Please stop separating families.  The criteria to qualify for Indefinite Leave to Remain is too strict.
attributes.additional_details: Couples who marry within or outside the UK and have been married for over 5 years are obviously sincere. Having children together makes them more sincere. A desire to work and not access public funds makes them value added to British society. Please encourage families to stay together and live happily in the UK. Please stop encouraging mothers to be single and creating dysfunctional children due to absent fathers. UK is the UNITED KINGDOM not DIVIDED KINGDOM. Keep love and unity as the motto.

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher maths papers and make one whole paper for everyone.
attributes.background: As everyone knows, there is higher and foundation maths. Foundation is for those who aren't as able at Maths but sometimes people are wrongly placed there. Make one whole paper for everyone, you never know what people could achieve. It would be fair to everyone if we all do the higher paper.
attributes.additional_details: The highest grade you can get for Foundation maths is C and it's known that its much easier to get a C in higher. Most people in foundation maths could easily get a 8 or a 9 (A's). The paper should be equal.

attributes.action: More funding for the treatment of schizophrenia and chronic mental illnesses.
attributes.background: It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the uk have a mental illness of some kind during their lifetime. At any one time about 220,000 people are being treated directly for schizophrenia in the UK by the NHS. Sufferers have the highest rates of suicide partly due to the Ill side effects of neuroleptic
attributes.additional_details:
More funding is needed to find a possible alternative to antipsychotics like cbd oil which has the potential to cure the disease short term without the side effects associated with neuroleptics.

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/ministryofhemp.com/blog/cbd-for-schizophrenia/amp/

https://www.livingwithschizophreniauk.org/facts-and-figures/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-17940070

attributes.action: Change PE back to 60% practical 40% theory
attributes.background: If it’s called physical education, why is there more theory then practical?

attributes.action: Build a Channel bridge between UK & France, to increase trade as we leave the EU
attributes.background: Build a Channel bridge between Britain and France to vastly increase trade between not just these two countries, but the entirety of Europe also. During uncertain times as we leave the European Union, such a project would reassure voters with increased economic confidence for the future.
attributes.additional_details: Would allow for easier access into both countries, making trade between UK and Europe much more easier.

attributes.action: Devolve responsibility for immigration policy in Scotland.
attributes.background: It looks like the EU migrants are now leaving the UK after Brexit and we don’t want that.  So, I call on the UK government to devolve some powers over immigration, especially the responsibility over immigration policy to the Scottish Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: We, Scots welcome immigrants to come and live in Scotland, and work in Scotland, when England doesn’t.  We welcome especially EU migrants, who pay their taxes raised in Scotland and contribute to our economy and if they go, we will miss out.  So we need them.  I know we haven’t known about this before, but countries like Canada and Australia have regional/provincial immigration policies within a nation-wide framework.

attributes.action: UK must ratify the optional protocol to the UN Rights of the Child Convention.
attributes.background: This important addition to the Convention gives members of the public and child sexual abuse victims the right to directly raise issues & complaints with the UN Committe on the Rights of the Child and its members. The majority of EU countries have ratified but the UK is conspicuous by its absence.
attributes.additional_details: The unratifed "communication" protocol  allows child sex abuse victims to raise complaints directly with the UN Committee in relation to public authorities failing to safeguard and protect children in relation to child sexual abuse after exhausting all internal remedies. That this protocol has not been ratified is bizarre given the UK's failings in this area.  Failings which have become somewhat of a daily news occurrence in recent years.  It would give individual abuse victims a voice at the UN.

attributes.action: Make the purchase and use of pepper spray and/or stun devices legal.
attributes.background: It is almost illegal to defend yourself in the UK. I think it is about time; especially considering current situation, that it changes. It should be legal to carry an item for the purpose of defence and the above items should be legalised, even if licensing is required.

attributes.action: Make it law for all age restricted products to require approved photo ID.
attributes.background: Across the country retail workers face verbal and physical abuse because of asking to see ID. The guessing of a customers age is what causes these cases of abuse with customers trying to intimidate the member of staff into selling the product. A no ID no sale law would put an end to the daily abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that there are more than 6000 incidents a day of verbal or physical abuse of retail workers because they requested to see ID for an age restricted product. A simple law that states no ID no sale on all age restricted products would remove the possibility of human error in having to guess people's ages and would help to stop the verbal and physical abuse that occurs because of this.

attributes.action: Demonstrate how more disabled people in the workforce has impacted productivity.
attributes.background: On the 6/12/17, whilst giving evidence to the commons Treasury Select committee, Phillip Hammond stated that "It is almost certainly the case that...very high levels of engagement in the workforce, for example of disabled people...may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements.
attributes.additional_details:
For a full transcript, follow the link

http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/treasury-committee/budget-autumn-2017/oral/75188.html

attributes.action: Make schools and colleges have longer or more breaks between working times.
attributes.background: Many schools do not have long enough breaks between work periods, I suggest the solution that schools and colleges get more time at breaks or have breaks at regular intervals. Such as expanding a 15 minute break to being 25 minutes to encourage socialising to make school an enjoyable environment.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killers
attributes.background: Codeine is a drug that is sold without prescription in the UK. It is used by drug addicted in order to “get high” in big dosage, which is equal to what’s contained in one pack (30 tablets). It is banned for opened sale in US, Germany, Japan and Australia.

attributes.action: Make sure we get a Brexit Deal.
attributes.background: If Brexit didn't have a deal, it would be chaos for us. If we can't get a  deal, we're on our own, and we'll have to rely on other countries to give us power and maybe being the end of the UK altogether. So there must be a Brexit deal, or we're in anarchy.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.businessinsider.com/why-norways-prison-system-is-so-successful-2014-12?international=true&r=US&IR=T 

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: I believe that every adult in the UK should pay £10 a month to the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been admitted into hospital twice in 5 years for 2 major life changing operations. I noticed how loving and caring the porters, nurses, doctors and surgeons all were. I was very shocked to see that they work 12+ hours a day, clean, cook, pay for parking and bring their own food.
attributes.additional_details: I would rather spend my £13.12 (which I have to pay every month for my BBC TV LICENCE) on the NHS. It should be compulsory!

attributes.action: Name one Dreadnought class submarine "HMS Thunder Child"
attributes.background: One of the new Dreadnought class submarines should be named "HMS Thunder Child" in honour of H.G. Wells' hero ship from War of the Worlds. This would infuse a sense of identity and culture being influenced by the famous literature of our nation.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Thunder Child is the fictional ironclad warship that destroys two Martian tripods in HG Wells' War of the Worlds before being sunk by a heat ray from a third tripod.

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action: Standardise the tax rates for employment income with all other income sources
attributes.background:
If you receive most income from your employment, there is a 99% chance that you are probably ‘poor’ or, at least, not part of the 1% high wealth individuals.
The wealthy avoid high employment income tax rates and instead exploit generous allowances and lower tax rates on all other forms of income.
attributes.additional_details:
By standardising the tax rates on all forms of income, employment tax rates will fall since the disproportionate tax benefits available to the super-rich only will be reduced to create a fair tax system.

All income say, under £1m, including receipts from loans from non-UK sources and gains from share schemes, should be treated equally for tax purposes and thereafter a minimum tax rate of 10% should cap any excessive tax breaks. 
Personal allowance and capital gain exemption could also be combined.

attributes.action: Put a tax on fish so fish can flourish more in the ocean.
attributes.background: Over fishing is declining fishes numbers so if there were a tax on buying them fishing would decline and the government would get more money.

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.

attributes.action: Ban Cryptocurrency
attributes.background: Cryptocurrency such as Bitcoin is a payment method that is used in Dark Web to make make payments for criminal transactions such as fake notes, passports and even drugs. This need to be banned to clean up our society so that no criminal activity using this payment method takes place in the UK.

attributes.action: Scrap the government’s plan of building HS2 and build a Hyperloop system instead
attributes.background: Instead of spending billions of pounds of taxpayer’s money on a system that will take so long to complete that it will already be antiquated, the government should invest in a Hyperloop system, reducing journey times exponentially, with speeds of up to 700mph. Manchester to London in 18 minutes!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2017/08/26/britains-hyperloop-pipe-dream-meet-people-behind-uks-futuristic/

http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/hyperloop-one-richard-branson-virgin-investment-london-scotland-transport-travel-fast-a7998106.html

https://hyperloop-one.com

attributes.action: Reform the UK prison system by adopting a more rehabilitative approach.
attributes.background: The UK prison system is failing. It does not meet the aims of punishment or prevention and doesn't even act as a deterrent as 47% of people leaving prison reoffend within a year (70% for those U18). This needs to change and we propose the change can come from more actively rehabilitating offenders..
attributes.additional_details: Rehabilitating offenders equips them with skills necessary to enter the world of employment. 50% of offenders have a reading age below 11 and 82% have a writing age below 11. To manage everyday tasks people need a reading age above 11 and so once offenders serve their sentence, they re-enter society with the same lack of skills they entered with. This means that they are likely to get involved with things that led them to prison in the first place, resulting in reoffending. Things must change!

attributes.action: Naturalisation fees should be reduced significantly, especially for refugees.
attributes.background: Paying fees for Naturalisation or Citizenship, became a nightmare for all people and especially refugees. Family of 5 people have to pay around £6000 to 7000.

attributes.action: Devolve Corporation Tax to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: We want lower taxes for businesses in Scotland, which probably means lower corporation tax rather than lower income tax. So now, I call on the UK government to devolve corporation tax.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish Parliament had the power to set corporation tax at a lower rate, then it would encourage more businesses to move up to Scotland. In my opinion, this would probably suit a lot of businesses. And I would also call on all parties at Westminster to work together to achieve this.

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums increased to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.
